html.p: Let [mathjaxinline]{\bf {F}}[/mathjaxinline] be a field. A function [mathjaxinline]T: {\bf {F}}^ n \rightarrow {\bf {F}}^ m[/mathjaxinline] is a linear transformation if both of the following properties hold:

li.p: For any vectors [mathjaxinline]\mathbf{v}, \mathbf{w}[/mathjaxinline] in the domain, [mathjaxinline]T(\mathbf{v}+ \mathbf{w}) = T(\mathbf{v}) + T(\mathbf{w}).[/mathjaxinline]
For any vector [mathjaxinline]\mathbf{v}[/mathjaxinline] in the domain, and any scalar [mathjaxinline]a\in {\bf {F}}[/mathjaxinline], [mathjaxinline]T(a\mathbf{v}) = aT(\mathbf{v})[/mathjaxinline].

html.p: Informally, if [mathjaxinline]T[/mathjaxinline] satisfies the first condition we say that “[mathjaxinline]T[/mathjaxinline] respects vector addition", and if [mathjaxinline]T[/mathjaxinline] satisfies the second condition we say that “[mathjaxinline]T[/mathjaxinline] respects scalar multiplication."
